title.value: PCRC Data Available for Secondary Analysis

body.value:
Statin Discontinuation

Multisite randomized trial of continuing versus discontinuing statins

  • JAMA Intern Med. 2015 May;175(5):691-700
  • Primary objective: to determine, among patients with life-limiting illness, if there is a difference in the proportion who die within 60 days after enrollment between patients for whom statins are discontinued versus patients who are maintained on the medication
  • Secondary objectives: overall survival, important CVD events, QOL, symptoms, performance status (Karnofsky), polypharmacy, satisfaction with care, costs
  • Total N: 381, 15 study sites

Best Supportive Care

Implementation of consensus-based standards for best supportive care in a clinical trial: a pilot study

  • J Clin Oncol. 2017 35:15_suppl, e21682-e21682.
  • Primary objective: using clinician behavior intervention checklist (BSC), test the feasibility of thorough documentation of BSC delivery
  • Secondary: estimate variance in the BSC checklist completion; assess provider satisfaction with BSC; evaluate differences in patient experience before and after introduction of the BSC checklist
  • Total N: 41 patients and 23 providers, 4 study sites

Reducing End-of-Life Symptoms with Touch (REST)

Massage therapy versus simple touch to improve pain and mood in patients with advanced cancer: a randomized trial

  • Ann Intern Med. 2008 Sep 16;149(6):369-79.
  • Primary objective: To evaluate the efficacy of massage for decreasing pain and symptom distress and improving quality of life among persons with advanced cancer
  • Repeated measures, six 30-minute massage or simple-touch sessions over 2 weeks
  • 380 adults with advanced cancer who were experiencing moderate-to-severe pain; 90% were enrolled in hospice
  • Total N: 380 patients, 15 hospice study sites

Patient-Centered Disease Management for Heart Failure (PCDM)

Multisite randomized clinical trial of a collaborative care PCDM intervention versus usual care in patients with heart failure (HF)

  • JAMA Intern Med. 2015 May;175(5):725-32.
  • Intervention: Collaborative care by a multidisciplinary care team consisting of a nurse coordinator, cardiologist, psychiatrist, and primary care physician; home telemonitoring and patient self-management support; and screening and treatment for comorbid depression
  • Primary objective: To determine the effectiveness of the PCDM intervention in improving the HF specific health status (measured with the Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire (KCCQ)) of participants
  • Secondary objective: To determine the effectiveness of the PCDM intervention on mortality, hospitalization, and depressive symptoms (Patient Health Questionnaire 9)
  • Total N: 392 patients, 4 VA medical center sites

Is death rattle a phenomenon that requires medical treatment?

Multisite prospective two-group observation study of respiratory distress in dying patients with and without death rattle

  • J Palliat Med. 2013 Oct;16(10):1255-9.
  • Intervention: Collaborative care by a multidisciplinary care team consisting of a nurse coordinator, cardiologist, psychiatrist, and primary care physician; home telemonitoring and patient self-management support; and screening and treatment for comorbid depression
  • Primary objective: To determine if patients with naturally occurring death rattle experience respiratory distress
  • Total N: 71 patients, 3 palliative care and hospice sites

field_subtitle.value: The PCRC has the following de-identified datasets available for secondary analysis in the PCRC Data Repository
